website_summaries.verdict: An Android-powered e-reader with a stylus for convenient note taking.
pros: The 20-cm 300-ppi screen, combined with the responsive stylus, makes this one of the best e-readers for note taking
Compatible with several Android apps, making this a pseudo tablet with an e-ink screen
cons: The battery life is far shorter than that of most e-readers, but it outpaces most tablets

customer_reviews.title: A new world for ereaders
customer_reviews.text: Been a Kindle user for 10 years. This was my first non-Kindle ereader. I was mostly interested in the larger screen and the ability to take notes. But this is an amazing device. An overwhelming amount of features and options. Fantastic reading experience and writing/drawing with the stylus exceeded all expectations for me. Yes it costs more than the regular Kindles, but it's the same price as a fully loaded Oasis 2 with so many more features.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Peters

customer_reviews.title: False marketing on the USB-C charging
customer_reviews.text: Got this device as it is the only USB-C e-reader on the market that I can find. Turn out, not all the USB-C can charge, it only works with 5V 2.4A charger, which equivalent to that small 5W iPhone adapter since first/second gen. Your MacBook adapter can't charge this, nor your iPad, switch, or any regular USB-C adapter. This is just a Mirco-USB speed inside a USB-C head. Why don't they just stick to Mirco-USB? It is at least easier to find a type-A to mirco-USB cable, than finding type-A to usb-C cable around.
customer_reviews.author: GTKKK

customer_reviews.title: Less secure than Android
customer_reviews.text: I just bought an Onyx Nova Pro and while the Google play app is available on the stock device, I could not access the app Store because Google play protect is not active. It is unacceptable not to have the security protocols in place, and I certainly an not giving my passwords for important services to a company without Google play protect. While the nova pro was great hardware, I had to return the device and continue my search for an Android e reader because the software is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Run With Them Or Fear Them

customer_reviews.title: Generaelly underwhelming.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this thing, but I just couldn't. The broken english all over the software is pretty terrible, and its horribly confusing to enable the google play store so you can install apps. Even once you figure it out, its still a pain to figure out how to make the apps run well, the settings menus are super unclear, confusing, and inconsistent. The writing features are laggy and just not as good as something like an ipad, I'd prefer a better device for handwriting (and that could help cut the cost of this thing down, which would make it a better value...) All in all, this thing tries to do too much, and fails at all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Carr

customer_reviews.title: PDF navigation is so painful
customer_reviews.text: I may give more stars if this problem can be fixed: I read a lot of PDFs and I need to zoom in to read, but when I navigate to a area I want it to be, it doesn't stay there but jump to the end of the page (Show in the video). Since the refreshing speed is slow, I ended up spending a lot of time adjust where I want to read. Writing functions are cool but if reading is not pleasant, I am still disappointed at this device.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent e-book reader
customer_reviews.text: I got Nova pro in April. I felt very bad when used it with the software that came(December 2018). It was very slow, unresponsive and didn't include much features especially for PDFs. I bought this reader especially for reading pdfs alone. With the software update that I got once changed the language to Chinese, I felt excellent in all the perspectives. If reader size is little bigger than 7.8" then it would sweep the market in this category. Their software is top notch in terms of features. I have kindle fire prior to Nova pro.
customer_reviews.author: subrahmanyam

customer_reviews.title: Painful set up to make it functional, but useful after.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is really short, especially if you are using wifi / Bluetooth. A full charge last me one day setting up the reader. You are probably not going to like the reader as you receive it. No English manual included on the ereader, which is ridiculous in a device design to read electronic files. Painful activation of Google Play Store that took me many tries. But after customizing and install the useful apps, it is worth in my opinion after using for one week.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre Akira Takamatsu

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, but not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good tablet for reading ebooks. Pretty good screen with great resolution. Even though the screen is 7.8" it turned smaller than I anticipated/expected. Most applications don't use the full screen size very well, so a lot of space wasted on blank borders. I think it's too expensive for what it has to offer. It is no different than a 2-3 year old Android tablet but with an e-ink screen (Android 6.0). I ended up selling the tablet and bought a recent Samsung tablet for a fraction of this tablet's price even with more features (S-Pen).
customer_reviews.author: andyolivares

customer_reviews.title: Buggy, slow, became completely unusable. Ares Note is better
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this for a few weeks. Really liked the pen feature. Really liked android on there. I tapered my expections. However the device kept getting buggier and buggier until last week it entered into modes where the touch screen would go schizo and the device literally became unusable. i'm thankful that it was within the return window. I quickly purchased the Ares Note which is the direct competitor to this and have felt that it is much faster, reliable, and overall a better experience.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best Choice if you’re looking for an E-Reader.
customer_reviews.text: Good tablet. Unfortunately, for me, I only wanted an e-reader, and the Nova Pro just didn’t work out as I had hoped. I really did want to like it, but the imbedded e-reader was clumsy and trying to use the Kindle app was frustrating. It kept refreshing with a visual lag every few minutes, even with all the app settings changed that others recommended. The Kindle page turns were unreliable and often took me to a page overview. Adjusting the backlight was clumsy, requiring you to leave the app and go back to the home screen. At the end of the day, since I was only using it as an e-reader, it just didn’t do the job...it got returned.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleAM

customer_reviews.title: Bad Battery, Slow and buggy
customer_reviews.text: This is a really slow Android device. It looks good but not worth the money. E ink is easy on the eyes but the device is so limited as to what it will do. I ready RSS feeds and news with apps like Feedly and it sucks on the Nova Pro. It's not a matter of black and white vs color. It's slow and buggy. I just bought a 228 dpi Samsung Tab A 2019 and with Moon Reader it is way more functional. I'll see if my eyes get tired. The battery life in the Nova Pro is pathetic for an E ink device.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Michael Wiesner

customer_reviews.title: PDF features not quite as good as they say
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use mostly for PDFs based on the statement that you could do a lot of tweaking to view PDFs better. This did not turn out to be true. I had a difficult time getting it to display properly and my Kindle Oasis actually displays PDFs better. So I sent it back. Very disappointed because I wanted to get the bigger eink screen.
customer_reviews.author: Alic

customer_reviews.title: Been looking for a tablet for sketching, not reading
customer_reviews.text: It is what I expected to be, not disappointed. Small enough to carry around if wanted. I own an iPad and iPad Pro, but wanted something else for sketching. Though, while I wanted this size, it is not 100% comfortable to hold. Still, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. David

customer_reviews.title: I love taking notes on it.
customer_reviews.text: It's freeing not to have to rely on pen and paper. The writing experience is great. Did I mention it's also an eBook reader? I enjoy marking up my PDF's. Google Play store is great but don't expect your apps to look and respond exactly the same on an e-ink screen.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Karma

customer_reviews.title: No longer charges after just 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The tablet would no longer charge. Tried multiple power supplies and cables. The return window and support window both closed. It's now a $300 paperweight.

customer_reviews.title: Promised Android 9.0 Upgrade Never Came
customer_reviews.text: Overall I actually enjoyed this device. However, I bought it in Oct 2019 with the expectation that we would get the upgrade from Android 6.0 -> 9.0. This is likely because they were going to release the 2.0 version which has Android 9.0.
customer_reviews.author: Physician Kindle Reader

customer_reviews.title: If you want an e-ink tablet experience, this is amazing
customer_reviews.text: It's such a great little tablet. I use Scribd, Kindle, Kobo, Libby all for reading bc I've owned so many different types of eink tablets through the years...This one is perfect because it allows you to have your pick of ebook format. It's also great for taking notes and I can even connect a bluetooth keyboard to write short stories on the device. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Dillman

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy with this tablet
customer_reviews.text: I was very on the fence about buying this tablet because of the mixed reviews, but I am very happy that I did. The tablet over all works great. I was concerned that the Kindle app would not run very well on the device but after optimizing it I have been happy with its performance. The only reason I'm giving it four stars is because the handwriting to type function does not track spacing very well. If they were to fix that this tablet would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Ratcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Indian languages are not supported
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device mainly for academic reading purposes. The experience is not good, as pdf font size cannot be varied. It is very tiring to read small font text for a long time. I downloaded google translator and handwriting input apps as I write poems in Kannada (an Indian language). Though these google apps support the language, the Kannada language option doesn't come up in this device which is very disappointing. Not happy. Better to buy any basic level tablet than this device. Totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Laks

customer_reviews.title: good

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and convenient
customer_reviews.text: It's small enough to be non-obtrusive and still functional enough to read books, take notes, etc. I also like the fact that it can run many Android apps from Google store. Highly recommended if you don't need the large format.
